title: 1996-A
statement: A. Legstime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputIt's another beautiful day on Farmer John's farm.After Farmer John arrived at his farm, he counted $$$n$$$ legs. It is known only chickens and cows live on the farm, and a chicken has $$$2$$$ legs while a cow has $$$4$$$.What is the minimum number of animals Farmer John can have on his farm assuming he counted the legs of all animals?InputThe first line contains single integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \\leq t \\leq 10^3$$$) — the number of test cases.Each test case contains an integer $$$n$$$ ($$$2 \\leq n \\leq 2 \\cdot 10^3$$$, $$$n$$$is even).OutputFor each test case, output an integer, the minimum number of animals Farmer John can have on his farm.ExampleInput3268Output1 2 2

processed.result: You are given a number representing the total number of legs counted. Chickens have 2 legs and cows have 4 legs. Find the fewest number of chickens and cows that could have made those legs.

You are given a number $n$ representing the total number of legs counted on a farm.  It is known that only chickens and cows live on the farm, and chickens have 2 legs while cows have 4 legs.  Find the minimum number of animals that could be on the farm. 

Input:

* The first line contains a number $t$ representing the number of test cases.
* Each test case contains a number $n$ representing the total number of legs.

Output:

* For each test case, output the minimum number of animals that could be on the farm.
